column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Oil  Apple pull Wall St lower
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 28 Wall Street fell on Monday  hurt by a steep drop in oil prices as well as a dip in Apple shares  pushing the S&P 500 back into negative territory for 2015.

column4: Samsung Pay plans to enable U.S. online shopping in 2016
column5: CHICAGO Samsung Electronics Co plans to expand its fledgling mobile payment service in the United States next year  allowing users to shop online and with more smartphones that support the electronic wallet.

column4: Chimerix antiviral drug fails  shares plummet to record low
column5: Chimerix Inc said its oral antiviral drug did not significantly reduce a certain kind of infection in stem cell transplant patients in a late-stage study  sending its shares to a record low.

column4: UPDATE 2-Chimerix antiviral drug fails  shares plummet to record low
column5: * Company to consult FDA on future steps for drug   (Adds details  analyst comments)

column4: Cisco wins U.S. patent dispute over wifi technology
column5: NEW YORK Cisco Systems Inc did not infringe a patent holding company's wifi technology  a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday  reversing a near $64-million judgment against the networking equipment maker in the long-running patent dispute.

column4: UPDATE 2-Cisco wins U.S. patent dispute over wifi technology
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 28 Cisco Systems Inc did not infringe a patent holding company's wifi technology  a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday  reversing a near $64-million judgment against the networking equipment maker in the long-running patent dispute.

column4: Cisco wins U.S. patent dispute over wifi technology
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 28 A U.S. appeals court on Monday cleared Cisco Systems Inc of infringing another company's wifi technology  reversing a near $64-million judgment against the networking equipment maker in the long-running patent dispute.

column4: Elbit Systems gets $70 million deal for electronic warfare systems
column5: TEL AVIV Defense electronics firm Elbit Systems Ltd said on Monday it won a contract worth about $70 million from the Israeli Ministry of Defense for the supply of electronic warfare systems.

column4: Elbit Systems gets $70 mln deal for electronic warfare systems
column5: TEL AVIV  Dec 28 Defence electronics firm Elbit Systems Ltd  said on Monday it won a contract worth about $70 million from the Israeli Ministry of Defence for the supply of electronic warfare systems.

column4: Carl Icahn trumps Bridgestone's offer for Pep Boys again
column5: Activist investor Carl Icahn trumped Japanese tire maker Bridgestone Corp's latest offer for Pep Boys-Manny Moe & Jack by $1.50 per share  as the bidding war for the U.S. auto parts retailer continues.

column4: Carl Icahn trumps Bridgestone's offer for Pep Boys again

column4: Two KaloBios directors quit following Shkreli's indictment
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 28 KaloBios Pharmaceuticals Inc  said on Monday that two directors had resigned in the wake of the arrest of former CEO Martin Shkreli on securities fraud charges earlier this month.

column4: China Telecom chairman under investigation as anti-graft probe widens
column5: BEIJING/HONG KONG The chairman of state-run China Telecom Corp Ltd is being investigated for alleged disciplinary violation  the ruling Communist Party's anti-corruption watchdog said  the latest senior executive to be caught in an anti-graft dragnet.

column4: UPDATE 2-China Telecom chairman under investigation as anti-graft probe widens
column5: * Chairman is latest executive ensnared in anti-graft crackdown

column4: Chipotle reopens Boston restaurant linked to norovirus outbreak
column5: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc said it reopened its Boston restaurant  which was linked to a norovirus outbreak that sickened more than 130 people earlier this month.

column4: Chipotle reopens Boston restaurant linked to norovirus outbreak
column5: Dec 28 Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc said it reopened its Boston restaurant  which was linked to a norovirus outbreak that sickened more than 130 people earlier this month.

column4: Deutsche Bank to sell Hua Xia stake for up to $4 billion
column5: FRANKFURT Deutsche Bank has agreed to sell its 20 percent stake in China's Hua Xia Bank to insurer PICC Property and Casualty Co for up to 25.7 billion yuan ($4 billion) as it seeks to raise cash and reduce its balance sheet exposure.

column4: UPDATE 2-Deutsche Bank to sell Hua Xia stake for up to $4 bln
column5: * Sale will boost CET1 ratio by 0.3-0.4 percentage points   (Adds book value of stake)

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Dec 28 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 1430 GMT on Monday:

column4: BRIEF-Deutsche Bank. Sal. Oppenheim to sell Hua Xia Bank's A-shares to PICC Property
column5: * Says Deutsche Bank Luxembourg  Deutsche Bank and Sal. Oppenheim agree to sell a combined 2.1 billion A-shares in the company to PICC Property and Casualty for up to 25.7 billion yuan  ($3.96 billion)

column4: Monte Paschi to sell 1 billion euro bad debt to vehicle linked to Deutsche Bank
column5: MILAN Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena has signed a binding agreement to sell a portfolio of non-performing loans with a gross book value of 1 billion euros ($1.1 billion) to a Deutsche Bank vehicle  Italy's third-largest bank said on Monday.

column4: Freeport-McMoRan Chairman James R. Moffett steps down
column5: Dec 28 Miner Freeport-McMoRan Inc said Chairman and co-founder James R. Moffett would step down from its board.

column4: JPMorgan to raise deposit rates for some big clients in Jan -WSJ
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co  will begin raising deposit rates for some of its biggest clients in January  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing a person familiar with the matter.

column4: Taiwan stocks steady before holidays; blue-chips up
column5: TAIPEI  Dec 28 Taiwan stocks rose in quiet trading on Monday before the New Year holidays  with shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) leading other blue-chips higher.

column4: Valeant selects trio to fill in for ailing CEO  shares dive
column5: NEW YORK Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  on Monday said a group of company executives will immediately take over for its chief executive officer until he returns from medical leave  news that sent its shares tumbling 10 percent.

column4: TABLE-Polish banks set for cash and shares from Visa deal
column5: (Adds Handlowy estimates)     Dec 28 Polish lenders stand to gain an injection of cash and Visa Inc shares after the world's largest payments network buys its subsidiary Visa Europe  of which local banks are among the members.     Visa said last month it would buy Visa Europe for up to $23.3 billion.      Below is a summary of Polish banks' estimates of how much they expect to receive from the deal  expected to be finalised in the second quarter of 2016:       Lender
